news.title: Man appears in court charged with murder of Joseph McEvoy following fatal Dublin stabbing
news.summary: A man has been charged with murdering a father of two who was fatally stabbed in an alleged attack at a house in Dublin.

news.title: Woman charged over dangerous driving death of ‘inspirational’ former teacher and cyclist
news.summary: A 32-year old west Clare woman has appeared in court charged in connection with the dangerous driving causing death of ‘inspirational’ school teacher, Michael Lorigan (70).

news.title: Runners and riders in Ireland’s race for the presidency – and where the potential candidates stand right now
news.summary: Sinn Féin leader Mary Lou McDonald has opened the door to contesting the presidential election in a move that could recast what had been billed as a lacklustre campaign.

news.title: Financial consultant ‘put his hands up’ in relation to alleged misappropriation of some €800,000
news.summary: A financial consultant has “put his hands up” in relation to the alleged misappropriation of some €800,000 from two companies which own a Dublin pub, the High Court heard.

news.title: Two doctors and secretary sent for trial accused of over 120 counts of theft
news.summary: Two midlands-based doctors and a secretary have been sent forward to stand trial, accused of multiple counts of stealing money under a state-funded healthcare reimbursement scheme and submitting false medical service claims on behalf of patients to the HSE.

news.title: ‘What I can’t take is this sense that we couldn’t be arsed to go to a game’ – RTÉ’s head of sport defends their coverage
news.summary: ‘Well, apart from medicine, irrigation, health, roads, cheese and education, baths and the Circus Maximus, what have the Romans ever done for us?’

news.title: ‘We can’t afford Mack Hansen and Finlay Bealham anymore’ – Stephen Larkham
news.summary: Stephen Larkham makes no bones about it. He views Mack Hansen and Finlay Bealham as ones that got away.

news.title: Tommy O’Brien: ‘I was thinking, this might be the end, my body is just not able for this’
news.summary: Tommy O’Brien had never started a Champions Cup game for Leinster when he was finally named in the team to take on La Rochelle back in January.

news.title: Sinéad Ryan: As a sunscreen Nazi who was once a sunburn pariah, I have a very simple idea to end Vat row
news.summary: Like most parents, I fail, regularly. The lowest bar is to keep your children safe, so exposing them to danger is a parenting no-no.

news.title: Former Australian football star settles crash injuries case against Virgin Media news presenter
news.summary: A former Australian football star has settled a personal injuries claim in the Circuit Civil Court against former TV news anchor Siobhán Bastible.
